pullRequest.title: New modules and tests for attributes
pullRequest.bodyText:
attribute g:d:o365EmailAddresses:o365mu is new attribute for
migration data from gr:d:o365EmailAddresses:mu

it has the same value -> array list of email addresses
syntaxCheck: duplicity is forbidden, email pattern is checked
semanticCheck: if group has attribute g:d:adName:o365mu set
to not-null, it has to be not-null too (there need to be a value).
Duplicities between other groups and members with
m:d:o365EmailAddresses:mu are forbidden.
fill: if group has attribute g:d:adName:o365mu set to not-null, it
will fill list with 1 value generated from adName



attribute g:d:adName:o365mu is new attribute for migration data from
gr:d:adName

is has unique String value (defined on attribute itself)
syntaxCheck: regex pattern is checked
semanticCheck: group can't be assigned to more than 1 resource with
set attribute r:d:adOuName in the sama facility



tests for both new modules were added

nodes.bodyText:
Judging by the commit message this attribute is not mentioned as unique by definition, you already check duplicates in checkAttributeSyntax(). Or you can have it unique and then remove that check, but it will prevent two different groups to have same email (not just unique within one attribute value), which I'm not sure is wanted or not.
Also do we care about case-insensitive or non-accented uniqueness too (remembering the problems with tcsMails:mu attribute)?

I'm not sure we rely on attribute definition from the module except the tests, since it might differ from the real perun instance state. Also subsequent call of getPerunBeanIdsForUniqueAttributeValue() requires attribute definition to have real id, which can't be present in this construct as is set to 0.
I suggest to get attribute definition by name (urn).
If the attribute will be unique, we don't have to check uniqueness through the same attribute, since its checked on inserting the value.

New modules and tests for attributes

 - it has the same value -> array list of email addresses
 - syntaxCheck: duplicity is forbidden, email pattern is checked
 - semanticCheck: if group has attribute g:d:adName:o365mu set
 to not-null, it has to be not-null too (there need to be a value).
 Duplicities between other groups and members with

 - fill: if group has attribute g:d:adName:o365mu set to not-null, it
 will fill list with 1 value generated from adName

 - is has unique String value (defined on attribute itself)
 - syntaxCheck: regex pattern is checked
 - semanticCheck: group can't be assigned to more than 1 resource with

 - tests for both new modules were added

afterCommit.message:
New modules and tests for attributes

 - attribute g:d:o365EmailAddresses:o365mu is new attribute for
 migration data from gr:d:o365EmailAddresses:mu
 - it has unique value as list of Strings (any value in list must be
 unique among all groups)
 - syntaxCheck: duplicity is forbidden, email pattern is checked
 - semanticCheck: if group has attribute g:d:adName:o365mu set
 to not-null, it has to be not-null too (there need to be a value).
 Duplicities between other groups and members with
 m:d:o365EmailAddresses:mu are forbidden.
 - fill: if group has attribute g:d:adName:o365mu set to not-null, it
 will fill list with 1 value generated from adName

 - attribute g:d:adName:o365mu is new attribute for migration data from
 gr:d:adName
 - is has unique String value (defined on attribute itself)
 - syntaxCheck: regex pattern is checked
 - semanticCheck: group can't be assigned to more than 1 resource with
 set attribute r:d:adOuName in the sama facility

 - tests for both new modules were added
